page.title: 06TATSFIELD CNTY.FIRST SCHOOL.
page.content: There are 96 children in the school Their ages are from 4 to 8 years.When they are 8 years old children travel by bus to Oxted or Hamsey Green.The school badge is a grasshopper and the school colours are red and green.There is a school bell,library and swimming pool. The first building of flint and brick was erected in 1846 at a cost of 142 pounds and the last enlargement took place in 1911.The church had control until 1931 when Surrey C.C. leased the school.The old log books record a smallpox epidemic,lack of fresh water, fuel and space. Children were kept away to help with the harvest,picking hops and lifting potatoes, Singing, needlework and drawing predominated as curriculum subjects. Grants were awarded on inspection results and children had to pay a small amount towards tuition.
